Posts.Content: Dec 23, 2014 09:24PM Cisco711 wrote: Kjones sending you all my prayers and positive thoughts from our shared state of North Carolina..hang in there,and keep us posted! Cisco
Posts.Title: Say a little prayer for me... Kjones13 KLynn

Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2015 12:35AM Cisco711 wrote: Hello Halaven Ladies! I have been on Affinator for almost a year with so so results. Markers went zooming upwards and scans showed some slight growth in the liver tumors. So here I come Halaven! I now it sounds so petty but I have done the hair loss thing before and I hated the wig. For the pat 2.5 years I have been working and living my life with none of my co workers knowing anything I would love to keep it that way but the SE of hair loss makes me think that the jig is up. Any ideas? My hair stylist has suggested getting the wig and then styling my hair around the wig so that it just flows together. I am optimistic for this treatment and I tolerated the SE's of Affinator very well. My workplace thrives on gossip and I am a private person so keeping this private is really important to me. Thanks for listening and I appreciate any advice. I know I am fortunate to be able to continue my life as "normal" and I am so grateful for that! Cisco711

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2014 02:10PM Cisco711 wrote: Thanks to all who have posted a response! I did have very low vitamin d on my blood work and since I have been taking the supplements it has helped a lot...still getting the leg cramps but not nearly as severe. Next Tuesday I get to talk with the onco and see what new trick he has up his sleeve. Since finding out about my recurrence last October I have been waiting to hear something positive about this miserable hand that fate has dealt...I am ready to kick some cancer butt! Cisco
Posts.Title: Moving from E+ to E-? Cisco711 Cisco711

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2014 11:18PM Cisco711 wrote: Njoy, I just had a liver biopsy two weeks ago in order to make sure the liver mets were ER+. Thankfully they are, which increases med options; the biopsy itself was nerve wracking, I should have asked for a sedative straight away but I waited and then opted once they started; I was so nervous I think that it made me tense and in turn I was emotionally a basket case! Bottom line is that we are fortunate to have a option for our doctors to peek at our insides without major surgery, it's so important to have accurate information so you can get the best treatment match. No doubt this is scary stuff we all deal with every second of everyday but I hope you will have positive news and I will be thinking the best for you! I have a sixteen year old daughter and I just try to gauge how much info she's up for on a day to day plan. Good news is that I am so fortunate to have a great husband, a fantastic daughter, and I have been blessed to have lived the past year without too much change to daily life. Breathe deep, you are not alone, and keep us updated! Many positive thoughts coming your way, Cisco711
Posts.Title: How are people with liver mets doing? blondie1 JFL

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2015 04:37PM Cisco711 wrote: I haven't posted in quite awhile but today I have great news: AA combo seems to be working on the liver mets! Last scan in February showed improvement but on this last one there is significant necrosis to the tumors. My TMs though are still rising...onc says when tumors are attacked they get angry and cause markers to rise-anyone have this happen to them? She is all about the scans so I don't go back till September! Also, has anyone actually felt the liver doing something? I swear I can feel a pulling and tightening on my right side...onc gave me one of those looks...you know the look! Please celebrate in spirit with me today-I pray all of us get to have some awesome happy news! Cisco711
Posts.Title: How are people with liver mets doing? blondie1 JFL

Posts.Content: Cisco711 wrote: Breast cancer with mets to bone and liver. I started with Tamoxifen  in October of last year, then put on Falsadex a few months later, in conjunction with Xgeva. Just had scans last week and although my markers are stable and I feel really good I seem to have some progression on the scans.Although I had a bone biopsy that came back E+ now my doctor has ordered a liver biopsy to see if the lesions are E-, since I have had no response with the estrogen positive therapies. Has anyone had a similar experience? Also, since on Xgeva I've had horrid leg/foot cramps..put on high level of vitamin D helps some but still waking up at night with serious cramps; anyone out there walking off leg cramps in the middle of the night? New to the site I am in awe of everyone out there! Dx 10/20/1999, Stage II, 3/10 nodes, ER+/PR- Surgery 11/12/1999 Prophylactic mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Chemotherapy 11/26/1999 Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxol (paclitaxel), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 10/20/2013 Dx 10/22/2013, Stage IV, mets, ER+ Radiation Therapy 10/25/2013 Bone Hormonal Therapy 3/10/2014 Faslodex (fulvestrant) Hormonal Therapy 10/8/2014 Aromasin (exemestane) Targeted Therapy 10/12/2014 Afinitor (everolimus) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Moving from E+ to E-? Cisco711 Cisco711

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2014 03:22PM Cisco711 wrote: Hi Lyn Just had my liver biopsy today and it was pretty rough...I think I was so anxious that I just couldn't handle the procedure without a sedative. I have a follow up appt with my onc next Tuesday to see what the next step will be. I too was devastated to find that the Falsadex was not working and honestly the thought of having to go to chemo really brings me down:even 14 yrs later those memories are fresh in my mind! My doctor ordered the biopsy because the hormonal therapy is not working even though the bone biopsy came back ER+ . The fact that I was able to get 13 years out of my last therapy gives me hope that once my doctor figures out the meds I will again respond to them... I can't think otherwise or I'll have to be on sedatives daily! Bottom line is I still feel good, don't have much pain, and I am blessed to work a job I love,travel with my family, and still live a fairly normal life but I'd be kidding myself that everyday there is a fear it will come crashing down. I'll be thinking positive thoughts that they will come up with the right meds for you, stay optimistic and please keep in touch! Cisco
Posts.Title: Moving from E+ to E-? Cisco711 Cisco711

I have a lot of confidence in my doctor to get me in the right direction ... I guess the mantra of "Scan, Treat, Repeat "has a lot of validity!  You ladies Rock!
